description: Introduce the title of the presentation, including the names of the authors and their affiliations.
Summarize the key points of the abstract, including the introduction to PPTAgent, its workflow, evaluation framework, and availability.
Discuss the challenges in creating presentations and how PPTAgent addresses these challenges. Highlight the comparison with conventional methods using the provided diagram (Figure 1).
Explain the workflow of PPTAgent, including the stages of presentation analysis and generation. Use the provided diagram (Figure 2) to illustrate the process.
Present the dataset used in the experiments, including statistics on the number of characters, figures, and pages for different domains. Use the provided table (Table 1).
Detail the experimental settings, baselines, and performance metrics. Use the provided tables (Table 2 and Table 3) to compare the performance of different models.
Explain the evaluation metrics used in the experiments, including SR, PPL, FID, and PPTEval. Highlight the importance of these metrics in assessing the quality of generated presentations.

Present the results of the experiments, including the number of iterative self-corrections required to generate slides (Figure 4), the correlation between human and LLM ratings (Table 4), and the error analysis (Figure 5).
Discuss related works in automated presentation generation, LLM agents, and LLMs as judges. Highlight the contributions of PPTAgent in this context.
Summarize the key findings and contributions of the research. Highlight the potential future directions and the impact of PPTAgent on automated presentation generation.
